ercent of first-time, first-year students with scores in each range:

Completion of 12 or more semester hours at an accredited university or college (including juniorand community colleges), with a GPA (on a 4.0 scale) of at least: 2.0 for Indiana residents, 2.0 forthose out of state residents who are covered by fee-reciprocity agreements that are in effect at thetime of application, 2.5 for all other applicants. If the applicant completed or attempted less than 12credit hours or has not completed a college level math or English course, they may be required toalso submit an official high school or GED transcript. The applicant has not been dismissed foracademic reasons from the institution he/she last attended.
The number of credits that count toward a degree will depend on program requirements. If courses

may count toward general electives or general education requirements rather than toward the

Courses for which IU South Bend does not have a course-to-course equivalency can sometimes betransferred in as undistributed (UNDI) credit. The decision as to how these UNDI credits will fit intoa degree program is made by the school or division in which a student will pursue a degree, but itmay be necessary to submit syllabi and course descriptions in order for a course-to-courseequivalency to be granted.
Prior university or college must be regionally accredited.
